poem:
**Uneasy Balance**

Europe stands  
between giants—  
ragged echoes,  
US and China  
whisper their weight.  
Macron calls  
for lighter steps—  
a dance of  
self, a wider  
grasp—  
to hold the balance,  
yet unsketched,  
of lingering dreams,  
in morning light.  
A continent freed  
from dual shadows,  
where its own  
footfall stirs the soil.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Europe should reduce US and China ‘dual dependencies’, Macron warns European countries need to reduce their “dual dependencies” on the US and China, Emmanuel Macron has warned, as he sketched out his vision of an empowered “wider Europe” on the first day of a historic state visit. The French president addressed several hundred MPs and guests at the start of a three-day state trip – the first state visit of a European leader since Brexit.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Europe should reduce US and China ‘dual dependencies’, Macron warns European countries need to reduce their “dual dependencies” on the US and China, Emmanuel Macron has warned, as he sketched out his vision of an empowered “wider Europe” on the first day of a historic state visit. The French president addressed several hundred MPs and guests at the start of a three-day state trip – the first state visit of a European leader since Brexit.
